results.title: Qantas: I Still Call Australia Home [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
Over twenty years, Qantas has produced a series of commercials featuring the Peter Allen song ‘I Still Call Australia Home’. This is the original mid 1980s version.
Produced by Mojo MDA.

results.title: Early Melbourne: from village to town
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Dr Bernard Barrett, State Historian, discusses the early development of Melbourne, covering such topics as the naming of Melbourne, who decided where the streets would be located and what they would be called.

results.title: World Series Cricket : C'mon Aussie c'mon [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
An advertisement for the first season of World Series Cricket featuring the now famous song ‘C’mon Aussie c’mon’ originally performed by the Mojo Singers.
Produced by Mojo MDA.

results.title: Ode to a shoebox
results.creator_credit: Narada Lawson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: The outside walls of the housing commission flats were as grey as a winter’s day and as cold as charity. But inside was a warm world of fun, love an adventure. This is an account of living in public housing in Melbourne.

results.title: Ozala
results.brief_description:
“Ozala” is an Afghani refugee who spent three years in a detention centre - his only crime was in wanting freedom. During this time in prison Ozala discovered the art of painting, where he could express his emotions, where shapes and colors became symbolic of his life and experiences and where he could escape to freedom. A thoughtful and reflective film interspersed with images of Ozala’s paintings.
In Farsi (Persian) with English subtitles
